title: Astra gears up for next launch, signs Spaceflight contract
summary: Astra Space says it will attempt its next Rocket 3.3 launch as soon as March 14 as the first flight in a multi-launch contract with Spaceflight.

title: Astra scrubs return-to-flight launch from Alaska
summary: Astra engineers identified two problems — an electrical design issue and a software glitch — that prevented a rocket from reaching orbit last month with a suite of NASA-sponsored CubeSats, clearing the way for a return-to-flight mission that could launch from Alaska this week. A launch attempt Monday was scrubbed due to bad weather.

title: Astra scrubs return to flight mission for weather
summary: Rocket 3.3, the first Astra rocket to successfully launch to orbit, will be returning to flight in what is sure to be a closely watched mission just over one month after ELaNa-41 failed during fairing and stage separation. The launch has been scheduled for Monday, March 14, in a 27-minute launch window that opened at 9:22 AM PDT (16:22 UTC), but this attempt was scrubbed when the triggered lightning potential violated launch weather constraints.
